note.title: ECE 204 ‚Äì Numerical Methods
note.content:
### üìö Concepts

**Week 1**
- Representation of real numbers

**Week 2**
- Tools for finding numerical algorithms
- Weighted averages
- Iteration and fixed-point iteration
- Linear algebra

**Week 3**
- Interpolation
- Taylor series
- Bracketing
- Intermediate-value theorem
- Summary of tools and looking ahead
- Types and sources of error

**Week 4**
- Introduction to approximating the value of expressions
- Evaluating a polynomial at a point and Horner's rule
- Using interpolating polynomials
- Approximating values using interpolating polynomials
- Approximating derivatives using interpolating polynomials

**Week 5**
- Approximating integrals using interpolating polynomials
- Least-squares best-fitting polynomials
- Approximating a point using least-squares best-fitting polynomials
- Approximating the derivative using least-squares best-fitting polynomials
- Approximating an integral using least-squares best-fitting polynomials

**Week 6**
- Approximating solutions to algebraic equations
- Approximating the solution to the quadratic equation
- Approximating solutions to non-linear algebraic equations
- Newton's method
- The bisection method
- The bracketed secant method
- The secant method
- Muller's method
- Inverse quadratic interpolation
- Approximating solutions to systems of linear equations
- The Gauss-Seidel method
- The method of successive over-relaxation

**Week 7**
- Approximating solutions to systems of non-linear equations
- Newton's method in n dimensions
- Approximating solutions to analytic equations
- Approximating solutions to ordinary differential equations (ODEs)
- Approximating solutions to initial-value problems (IVPs)
- Approximating solutions to first-order IVPs
- Euler's method

**Week 8**
- Heun's method
- The 4th-order Runge-Kutta method
- Error analysis of these methods
- Adaptive techniques for 1st-order initial-value problems (IVPs)
- Adaptive Euler-Heun method
- Adaptive Dormand-Prince method

**Week 9**
- Approximating solutions to systems of 1st-order IVPs
- Approximating solutions to higher-order IVPs
- Approximating solutions to systems of higher-order IVPs
- Approximating solutions to boundary-value problems
- The shooting method

**Week 10**
- The finite-difference method
- Neumann and insulated boundary conditions
- Approximating solutions to partial differential equations
- The heat equation in one dimension

**Week 11**
- The wave equation in one dimension
- Laplace's equation
- Optimization
- Optimizing functions of a real variable
- Step-by-step optimization
- Newton's method for finding extrema

**Week 12**
- The golden-ratio search
- Successive parabolic interpolation
- Optimizing functions of a vector variable
- Hooke-Jeeves method
- Newton's method for finding extrema in n dimensions
- Gradient descent

### üîó Backlinks

**Related Topics:**
- [[MATLAB]]
- [[Linear Algebra]]
- [[Interpolation]]
- [[Root Finding]]
- [[Newton's Method]]
- [[Differential Equations]]
- [[Runge-Kutta Methods]]
- [[Optimization]]
- [[Partial Differential Equations]]
- [[Finite Difference Method]]

sourceNote.title: üè´ University of Waterloo
sourceNote.content:
### üéì Bachelor of Computer Engineering

## üìò 1A Term
- COMMST 192 ‚Äì Communication in the Engineering Profession
- ECE 105 ‚Äì Classical Mechanics
- ECE 150 ‚Äì Fundamentals of Programming
- ECE 190 ‚Äì Engineering Profession and Practice
- ECE 198 ‚Äì Project Studio
- MATH 115 ‚Äì Linear Algebra for Engineering
- MATH 117 ‚Äì Calculus I for Engineering

## üìó 1B Term
- ECE 106 ‚Äì Electricity and Magnetism
- ECE 108 ‚Äì Discrete Mathematics and Logic 1
- ECE 124 ‚Äì Digital Circuits and Systems
- ECE 140 ‚Äì Linear Circuits
- ECE 192 ‚Äì Engineering Economics and Impact on Society
- MATH 119 ‚Äì Calculus II for Engineering

## üìô 2A Term
- [[ECE 109 ‚Äì Materials Chemistry for Engineers]]
- [[ECE 204 ‚Äì Numerical Methods]]
- [[ECE 205 ‚Äì Advanced Calculus 1 for Electrical and Computer Engineers]]
- [[ECE 222 ‚Äì Digital Computers]]
- [[ECE 240 ‚Äì Electronic Circuits 1]]
- [[ECE 250 ‚Äì Algorithms and Data Structures]]

## üß© PD Courses
- PD 19 ‚Äì Tactics for Workplace Success
- PD 20 ‚Äì Strategies for Career Success
- PD 10 ‚Äì Professional Responsibility in Computing
- PD 22 ‚Äì Professionalism and Ethics in Engineering Practice

## üå± Reflections from My Journey
Build systems for yourself ‚Äî good habits compound.
Learn how to learn. Spend real time thinking about how to understand things deeply and meaningfully.

Always ask yourself why you're doing something. What kind of life do I want to live after university?

There will be moments in university when you feel lonely. Don't stay in bed ‚Äî step outside.

Every experience and every choice shapes who I am. Don‚Äôt be afraid ‚Äî just try.

We live in a world of constant change, and we never know when it will shift. If I accept that anything in my life can change unexpectedly, then decisions become less scary. What matters most is having the confidence that whatever happens, I'll adapt and find my way again.

### üöÄ My Approach to Internships
There's nothing more certain than actually trying something. Being inside an organization reveals sides of myself I didn't know existed. That's why I shouldn't assume beforehand what I will or won't enjoy.

### üéØ Reminder to myself
Don't waste energy debating whether a choice is right or wrong. **Make the choice right by the way you commit to it.**
